serviceRadius: We serve Denver and surrounding Front Range communities within 25 miles

areas.name: Denver
areas.description: {{businessName}} serves homeowners and businesses across {{city}}, from Capitol Hill Victorian renovations to new construction in RiNo. Our licensed electricians know Denver's diverse housing stock and the electrical challenges that come with it.
areas.localChallenges: Denver's neighborhoods are full of homes built in the 1940s–1970s with original knob-and-tube or aluminum wiring that poses a serious safety risk. At 5,280 feet elevation, electrical equipment runs differently and outdoor fixtures must withstand heavy snow loads, ice storms, and temperature swings of 50°F or more in a single day. Denver's rapid growth has driven heavy demand for EV charger and solar integration work.
serviceHighlights: EV charger installation — Level 2 home charging stations
Panel upgrades to 200A for older Denver homes

areas.name: Aurora
areas.description: Aurora is one of Colorado's largest cities and home to a diverse mix of older bungalows, mid-century ranch homes, and newer developments. {{businessName}} provides dependable electrical service across all of Aurora.
areas.localChallenges: Aurora's older west-side neighborhoods near Colfax have significant concentrations of aging Federal Pacific and Zinsco panels that are known fire hazards. Winter storms regularly damage outdoor service entrances and weatherheads. The city's large military and veteran population at Buckley often needs fast, trustworthy service with security-conscious crews.
serviceHighlights: Federal Pacific and Zinsco panel replacement
Storm damage repair and outdoor service entrance restoration
Whole-home rewire for mid-century ranch homes

areas.name: Lakewood
areas.description: Lakewood's mix of 1960s ranch homes, newer townhomes, and Belmar-area condos keeps {{businessName}} busy year-round. We understand the electrical systems common to Jefferson County and bring honest, licensed work to every job.
areas.localChallenges: Lakewood has a large inventory of post-war tract homes with original 100A panels that can no longer support modern appliances, EV chargers, and home offices simultaneously. Altitude and freeze-thaw cycles stress outdoor conduit and underground feeder runs. Many Applewood-area homes still have ungrounded two-prong outlets that violate current code requirements.
serviceHighlights: Panel upgrades from 100A to 200A or 400A service
Grounding and GFCI/AFCI outlet upgrades throughout the home
Outdoor lighting and weatherproof outlet installation

areas.name: Arvada
areas.description: From Olde Town Arvada's historic homes to newer subdivisions near Candelas, {{businessName}} brings licensed electrical expertise to every corner of the city. Arvada homeowners trust us for straightforward pricing and work done right the first time.
areas.localChallenges: Arvada's older Olde Town neighborhoods feature homes built in the early 1900s, many still with original 60A service panels and cloth-wrapped wiring. The city's rapid westward expansion toward the mountains means newer homes are integrating solar, battery backup, and EV charging simultaneously — requiring careful load management. Snow and ice on roof-mounted fixtures and satellite equipment frequently damages service entrances in winter.
serviceHighlights: Historic home rewire with minimal drywall disruption
Solar-ready panel upgrades and battery backup installation
Service entrance and weatherhead replacement after storm damage

areas.name: Centennial
areas.description: Centennial is one of Colorado's newest cities, but its housing stock spans several decades. {{businessName}} serves Centennial homeowners with the electrical expertise their homes deserve — from 1980s subdivisions to custom builds near Cherry Creek State Park.
areas.localChallenges: Centennial's 1970s–1990s homes frequently have aluminum branch wiring, which requires special connectors and outlet devices to meet code safely. The suburban density means underground utility work requires careful coordination with HOAs and the city. Centennial's high altitude and dry climate cause static discharge issues in finished basements without proper grounding.
serviceHighlights: Aluminum wiring remediation and CO/ALR outlet upgrades
EV charger installation in attached and detached garages
Basement finishing electrical — circuits, recessed lighting, home theater

areas.name: Boulder
areas.description: Boulder's progressive community leads the state in solar adoption, EV ownership, and energy-efficient home upgrades. {{businessName}} brings the licensed electrical expertise to match Boulder's forward-thinking approach to energy.
areas.localChallenges: Boulder's historic neighborhoods on Mapleton Hill and University Hill have some of the oldest wiring in the Front Range — knob-and-tube is still found in basements throughout the area. Xcel Energy's Boulder service territory has strict interconnect requirements for solar installations. At over 5,400 feet elevation, outdoor electrical fixtures face extreme UV exposure, freeze-thaw cycles, and occasional 100+ mph Chinook winds.
serviceHighlights: Solar-ready panel upgrades and Xcel interconnect compliance
Whole-home rewire for historic Boulder bungalows
EV charger installation — Tesla, ChargePoint, and universal J1772
